alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 05 at 1:47PM MDT until August 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO HOT, DRY, WINDY, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .A very unusual period of critical fire weather is expected to develop Monday as exceptionally dry westerly flow impacts northern NM. Hot, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will occur for several hours Monday afternoon across the northern high terrain, surrounding highlands and upper Rio Grande Valley. Similar conditions may exist on Tuesday but could likely expand across the Northwest Plateau as well. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...North Central Mountains (Zone 120), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
